item.title: Understanding Data Cleaning - Tidy Tuesday 07/07/2020
item.description: I love learning R. The language clicks with me, and I love understanding new methods to clean and manipulate data. Issues arise when I try and read code on how others clean data. So this post/series of posts may be more for my benefit alone, but I want to take code from outside sources and break down how they manipulate and clean their data. To start this, I’m taking a simpler code from the “Tidy Tuesday” Github repository (found here), since they post a simple code to clean the data for basic analysis.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am an Undergraduate Student at Utah State University, with an anticipated graduation of Spring 2021. I will graduate with a B.A. Majoring in Political Science and Minors in Japanese and Statistics.
